00096 void FillEmployee(Employee& emp)
00097 {
00098   static unsigned int index = 0;
00099 
00100   strcpy(emp.firstName, PEOPLE[index].firstName);
00101   strcpy(emp.lastName, PEOPLE[index].lastName);
00102   emp.salary = PEOPLE[index].salary;
00103   emp.years = PEOPLE[index].years;
00104   index++;
00105   if (index >= sizeof(PEOPLE) / sizeof(*PEOPLE))
00106     index = 0;
00107 }

00109 void DumpCallback(const void *block, size_t actual_size)
00110 {
00111   size_t size = actual_size;
00112     // limit to 16 bytes
00113   if (actual_size > 16)
00114     size = 16;
00115 
00116   unsigned char *data = const_cast<unsigned char*>(static_cast<const unsigned char *>(block));
00117 
00118   if (SHOWADDRESS1)
00119     printf("Block at 0x%p, %u bytes long.\n", block, static_cast<unsigned>(actual_size));
00120   else
00121     printf("Block at 0x00000000, %u bytes long.\n", static_cast<unsigned>(actual_size));
00122 
00123     // If we were passed a NULL pointer, do nothing
00124   if (!block)
00125     return;
00126 
00127   printf(" Data: <");
00128   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < size; i++)
00129   {
00130     unsigned char c = *data++;
00131     if (c > 31 && c < 128) // printable range
00132       printf("%c", c);
00133     else
00134       printf(" ");
00135   }
00136   printf(">");
00137 
00138   data = const_cast<unsigned char*>(static_cast<const unsigned char *>(block));
00139   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < size; i++)
00140     printf(" %02X", static_cast<int>(*data++));
00141   printf("\n");
00142 }

00145 {
00146 }

00148 void CheckAndDumpLeaks(const ObjectAllocator* oa)
00149 {
00150   if (oa->GetStats().ObjectsInUse_)
00151   {
00152     printf("Detected memory leaks!\n");
00153     printf("Dumping objects ->\n");
00154     unsigned leaks = oa->DumpMemoryInUse(DumpCallback);
00155     printf("Object dump complete. [%u]\n", leaks);
00156   }
00157   else
00158     printf("No leaks detected.\n");
00159 }
00160 
00161 void ValidateCallback(const void *block, size_t actual_size)
00162 {
00163   if (SHOWADDRESS2)
00164     printf("Block at 0x%p, %u bytes long.\n", block, static_cast<unsigned>(actual_size));
00165   else
00166     printf("Block at 0x00000000, %u bytes long.\n", static_cast<unsigned>(actual_size));
00167 
00168   if (!block)
00169     return;
00170 }

00180 template <typename T>
00181 void SwapT(T &a, T &b)
00182 {
00183   T temp = a;
00184   a = b;
00185   b = temp;
00186 }
00187 
00188 template <typename T>
00189 void Shuffle(T *array, unsigned count)
00190 {
00191   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
00192   {
00193     int r = RandomInt(static_cast<int>(i), static_cast<int>(count) - 1);
00194     SwapT(array[i], array[r]);
00195   }
00196 }

00198 template <typename T>
00199 void PrintArray(T *array, unsigned count)
00200 {
00201   for (unsigned i = 0; i < count; i++)
00202     std::cout << array[i] << std::endl;
00203 }

00210 #include <ctime>
00211 void Stress(bool UseNewDelete)
00212 {
00213   ObjectAllocator *oa;
00214     
00215   try
00216   {
00217     bool newdel = UseNewDelete;
00218     bool debug = false;
00219     unsigned padbytes = 0;
00220     OAConfig::HeaderBlockInfo header(OAConfig::hbNone);
00221     unsigned alignment = 0;
00222 
00223     OAConfig config(newdel, objects, pages, debug, padbytes, header, alignment);
00224     oa  = new ObjectAllocator(sizeof(Student), config);
00225     for (unsigned i = 0; i < total; i++)
00226     {
00227       void *p = oa->Allocate();
00228       ptrs[i] = p;
00229     }
00230 
00231     Shuffle(ptrs, total);
00232     for (unsigned i = 0; i < total; i++)
00233     {
00234       oa->Free(ptrs[i]);
00235     }
00236 
00237     delete oa;
00238   }
00239   catch (const OAException& e)
00240   {
00241     if (SHOW_EXCEPTIONS)
00242       cout << e.what() << endl;
00243     else
00244       cout << "Exception thrown during construction in Stress."  << endl;
00245 
00246     return;
00247   }
00248 }

00308 void TestFreeEmptyPages1(void)
00309 {
00310   if (!ObjectAllocator::ImplementedExtraCredit())
00311     return;
00312 
00313   ObjectAllocator *oa;
00314   const int objects = 4;
00315   const int pages = 3;
00316   const int total = objects * pages;
00317   void *ptrs[total];
00318   try
00319   {
00320     bool newdel = false;
00321     bool debug = true;
00322     unsigned padbytes = 2;
00323     OAConfig::HeaderBlockInfo header(OAConfig::hbNone);
00324     unsigned alignment = 0;
00325 
00326     OAConfig config(newdel, objects, pages, debug, padbytes, header, alignment);
00327     oa  = new ObjectAllocator(sizeof(Student), config);
00328 
00329     unsigned width = 32; 
00330 
00331     for (int i = 0; i < total; i++)
00332     {
00333       void *p = oa->Allocate();
00334       ptrs[i] = p;
00335     }
00336     //****************************************************************************
00337     PrintConfig(oa);
00338     PrintCounts(oa);
00339     DumpPages(oa, width);
00340 
00341     for (int i = 0; i < objects; i++)
00342       oa->Free(ptrs[i + 0]);
00343 
00344     for (int i = 0; i < objects; i++)
00345       oa->Free(ptrs[i + 8]);
00346 
00347     //****************************************************************************
00348     PrintCounts(oa);
00349     DumpPages(oa, width);
00350 
00351     //****************************************************************************
00352     oa->FreeEmptyPages();
00353     PrintCounts(oa);
00354     DumpPages(oa, width);
00355 
00356     //****************************************************************************
00357     for (int i = 0; i < objects - 1; i++)
00358       oa->Free(ptrs[i + 4]);
00359     oa->FreeEmptyPages();
00360     PrintCounts(oa);
00361     DumpPages(oa, width);
00362 
00363     //****************************************************************************
00364     oa->Free(ptrs[7]);
00365     oa->FreeEmptyPages();
00366     PrintCounts(oa);
00367     DumpPages(oa, width);
00368 
00369 
00370     //****************************************************************************
00371     printf("\n\n");
00372     void *p = oa->Allocate();
00373     oa->FreeEmptyPages();
00374     PrintCounts(oa);
00375     DumpPages(oa, width);
00376 
00377     oa->Free(p);
00378     //oa->FreeEmptyPages();
00379     PrintCounts(oa);
00380     DumpPages(oa, width);
00381 
00382     oa->FreeEmptyPages();
00383     PrintCounts(oa);
00384     DumpPages(oa, width);
00385 
00386     delete oa;
00387   }
00388   catch (const OAException& e)
00389   {
00390     if (SHOW_EXCEPTIONS)
00391       cout << e.what() << endl;
00392     else
00393       cout << "Exception thrown during TestFreeEmptyPages1."  << endl;
00394 
00395     return;

00512

00774   }
00775   catch (const OAException& e)
00776   {
00777     if (SHOW_EXCEPTIONS)
00778       cout << e.what() << endl;
00779     else
00780       cout << "Exception thrown from Allocate in TestExtendedHeaderBlocks."  << endl;
00781   }
00782   catch(...)
00783   {
00784     cout << "Unexpected exception thrown from Allocate in TestExtendedHeaderBlocks."  << endl;
00785   }
00786 
00787   DumpPages(oa, wrap);
00788 
00791   try
00792   {
00793     oa->Free(pStudent1);
00794   }
00795   catch (const OAException& e)
00796   {
00797     if (SHOW_EXCEPTIONS) 
00798       cout << e.what() << endl;
00799     else
00800       cout << "Exception thrown from Free in TestExtendedHeaderBlocks."  << endl;
00801   }
00802   catch(...)
00803   {
00804     cout << "Unexpected exception thrown from Free in TestExtendedHeaderBlocks."  << endl;
00805   }
00806 
00807   DumpPages(oa, wrap);
00808 
00811   try
00812   {
00813     oa->Free(pStudent2);
00814   }
00815   catch (const OAException& e)
00816   {
00817     if (SHOW_EXCEPTIONS) 
00818       cout << e.what() << endl;
00819     else
00820       cout << "Exception thrown from Free in TestExtendedHeaderBlocks."  << endl;
00821   }
00822   catch(...)
00823   {
00824     cout << "Unexpected exception thrown from Free in TestExtendedHeaderBlocks."  << endl;
00825   }
00826 
00827   DumpPages(oa, wrap);
00828 
00831   try
00832   {
00833     pStudent1 = static_cast<Student *>( oa->Allocate() );
00834     //pStudent2 = static_cast<Student *>( oa->Allocate() );
00835   }
00836   catch (const OAException& e)
00837   {
00838     if (SHOW_EXCEPTIONS)
00839       cout << e.what() << endl;
00840     else
00841       cout << "Exception thrown from Allocate in TestExtendedHeaderBlocks."  << endl;
00842   }
00843   catch(...)
00844   {
00845     cout << "Unexpected exception thrown from Allocate in TestExtendedHeaderBlocks."  << endl;
00846   }
00847 
00848   DumpPages(oa, wrap);
00849 
00852   try
00853   {
00854     for (int i = 0; i < 5; i++)
00855     {
00856       oa->Free(pStudent1);
00857       pStudent1 = static_cast<Student *>( oa->Allocate() );
00858     }
00859   }
00860   catch (const OAException& e)
00861   {

00870   }
00871

00873 
00876   try
00877   {
00878     pStudent2 = static_cast<Student *>( oa->Allocate() );
00879   }
00880   catch (const OAException& e)
00881   {
00882     if (SHOW_EXCEPTIONS)
00883       cout << e.what() << endl;
00884     else
00885       cout << "Exception thrown from Allocate in TestExtendedHeaderBlocks."  << endl;
00886   }

00896 //****************************************************************************************************
00897 //****************************************************************************************************
00898 void TestExternalHeaderBlocks()
00899 {
00900   ObjectAllocator *oa = 0;
00901   unsigned wrap = 32;
00902 
00903   try 
00904   {
00905     bool newdel = false;
00906     bool debug = true;
00907     unsigned padbytes = 2;
00908     OAConfig::HeaderBlockInfo header(OAConfig::hbExternal);
00909     unsigned alignment = 0;
00910 
00911     OAConfig config(newdel, 4, 1, debug, padbytes, header, alignment);
00912     oa = new ObjectAllocator(sizeof(Student), config);
00913   }
00914   catch (const OAException& e)
00915   {
00916     if (SHOW_EXCEPTIONS)
00917       cout << e.what() << endl;
00918     else
00919       cout << "Exception thrown during construction in TestExternalHeaderBlocks."  << endl;
00920 
00921     return;
00922   }
00923

00925   PrintCounts(oa);
00926   DumpPagesEx(oa, wrap);
00927

00929   try
00930   {
00931     pStudent1 = static_cast<Student *>( oa->Allocate("First student") );
00932   }
00933   catch (const OAException& e)

00939   }

00941   {

00943   }

00947

00949   try
00950   {
00951     pStudent2 = static_cast<Student *>( oa->Allocate("Second student") );
00952   }
00953   catch (const OAException& e)
00954   {
00955     if (SHOW_EXCEPTIONS)
00956       cout << e.what() << endl;
00957     else

00959   }

01009 //****************************************************************************************************
01010 //****************************************************************************************************
01011 void DoStudents(unsigned padding, bool printall)
01012 {
01013   try 
01014   {
01015     bool newdel = false;
01016     bool debug = true;
01017     unsigned padbytes = padding;
01018     OAConfig::HeaderBlockInfo header(OAConfig::hbNone);
01019     unsigned alignment = 0;
01020 
01021     OAConfig config(newdel, 4, 2, debug, padbytes, header, alignment);
01022     studentObjectMgr = new ObjectAllocator(sizeof(Student), config);
01023   }
01024   catch (const OAException& e)
01025   {
01026     if (SHOW_EXCEPTIONS)
01027       cout << e.what() << endl;
01028     else
01029       cout << "Exception thrown during construction in DoStudents."  << endl;
01030     return;
01031   }
01032   catch(...)
01033   {
01034     cout << "Unexpected exception thrown from constructor in DoStudents."  << endl;
01035   }
01036 
01037   unsigned wrap = 32;
01038   PrintConfig(studentObjectMgr);
01039   PrintCounts(studentObjectMgr);
01040   DumpPages(studentObjectMgr, wrap);
01041 
01042   Student *pStudent1 = 0, *pStudent2 = 0, *pStudent3 = 0;
01043   try
01044   {
01045     pStudent1 = static_cast<Student *>( studentObjectMgr->Allocate() );
01046     PrintCounts(studentObjectMgr);
01047     if (printall)
01048       DumpPages(studentObjectMgr, wrap);
01049     pStudent2 = static_cast<Student *>( studentObjectMgr->Allocate() );
01050     PrintCounts(studentObjectMgr);
01051     if (printall)
01052       DumpPages(studentObjectMgr, wrap);
01053     pStudent3 = static_cast<Student *>( studentObjectMgr->Allocate() );
01054     PrintCounts(studentObjectMgr);
01055     if (printall)
01056       DumpPages(studentObjectMgr, wrap);
01057   }
01058   catch (const OAException& e)
01059   {
01060     if (SHOW_EXCEPTIONS)
01061       cout << e.what() << endl;
01062     else
01063       cout << "Exception thrown from Allocate in DoStudents."  << endl;
01064   }
01065   catch(...)
01066   { 
01067     cout << "Unexpected exception thrown from Allocate in DoStudents."  << endl;
01068   }
01069 
01070   Student *pStudent4[6];
01071   for (int i = 0; i < 6; i++)
01072   {
01073     try
01074     {
01075       pStudent4[i] = static_cast<Student *>( studentObjectMgr->Allocate() );
01076       if (pStudent4[i] == 0)
01077         break;
01078     }
01079     catch (const OAException& e)
01080     {
01081     if (SHOW_EXCEPTIONS)
01082       cout << e.what() << endl;
01083     else
01084       cout << "Exception thrown from Allocate (2) in DoStudents."  << endl;
01085 
01086       break;
01087     }
01088     catch(...)
01089     {
01090       cout << "Unexpected exception thrown from Allocate (2) in DoStudents."  << endl;
01091     }
01092 
01093   }
01094   PrintCounts(studentObjectMgr);
01095   if (printall)
01096     DumpPages(studentObjectMgr, wrap);
01097 
01098   try
01099   {
01100     studentObjectMgr->Free(pStudent1);
01101     PrintCounts(studentObjectMgr);
01102     if (printall)
01103       DumpPages(studentObjectMgr, wrap);
01104     studentObjectMgr->Free(pStudent2);
01105     PrintCounts(studentObjectMgr);
01106     if (printall)
01107       DumpPages(studentObjectMgr, wrap);
01108     studentObjectMgr->Free(pStudent3);
01109     PrintCounts(studentObjectMgr);
01110     if (printall)
01111       DumpPages(studentObjectMgr, wrap);
01112   }
01113   catch (const OAException& e)
01114   {
01115     if (SHOW_EXCEPTIONS)
01116       cout << e.what() << endl;
01117     else
01118       cout << "Exception thrown from Free in DoStudents."  << endl;
01119 
01120   }
01121   catch(...)
01122   {
01123     cout << "Unexpected exception thrown from Free in DoStudents."  << endl;
01124   }
01125 
01126   cout << "Most students in use: " << studentObjectMgr->GetStats().MostObjects_ << endl;
01127   delete studentObjectMgr;
01128 }
01129 
01130 //****************************************************************************************************
01131 //****************************************************************************************************
01132 void TestPadding(unsigned size)
01133 {
01134   DoStudents(size);
01135 }
01136 
01137 //****************************************************************************************************
01138 //****************************************************************************************************
01139 void DoEmployees(void)
01140 {
01141   try
01142   {
01143     bool newdel = false;
01144     bool debug = true;
01145     unsigned padbytes = 0;
01146     OAConfig::HeaderBlockInfo header(OAConfig::hbNone);
01147     unsigned alignment = 0;
01148 
01149     OAConfig config(newdel, 4, 2, debug, padbytes, header, alignment);
01150     employeeObjectMgr = new ObjectAllocator(sizeof(Employee), config);
01151   }
01152   catch (const OAException& e)
01153   {
01154     if (SHOW_EXCEPTIONS)
01155       cout << e.what() << endl;
01156     else
01157       cout << "Exception thrown during construction in DoEmployees."  << endl;
01158     return;
01159   }
01160   catch(...)
01161   {
01162     cout << "Unexpected exception thrown during constructor in DoEmployees."  << endl;
01163   }
01164 
01165   PrintConfig(employeeObjectMgr);
01166   PrintCounts(employeeObjectMgr);
01167 
01168   Employee *pEmployee1 = 0, *pEmployee2 = 0, *pEmployee3 = 0;
01169   try
01170   {
01171     pEmployee1 = static_cast<Employee *>(employeeObjectMgr->Allocate());
01172     PrintCounts(employeeObjectMgr);
01173     pEmployee2 = static_cast<Employee *>(employeeObjectMgr->Allocate());
01174     PrintCounts(employeeObjectMgr);
01175     pEmployee3 = static_cast<Employee *>(employeeObjectMgr->Allocate());
01176     PrintCounts(employeeObjectMgr);
01177   }
01178   catch (const OAException& e)
01179   {
01180     if (SHOW_EXCEPTIONS)
01181       cout << e.what() << endl;
01182     else
01183       cout << "Exception thrown from Allocate in DoEmployees."  << endl;
01184   }
01185   catch(...)
01186   {
01187     cout << "Unexpected exception thrown from Allocate in DoEmployees."  << endl;
01188   }
01189 
01190   Employee *pEmployee4[7];
01191   for (int i = 0; i < 7; i++)
01192   {
01193     try 
01194     {
01195         // Need to use /EHa, not /EHs
01196         // ******************************************* Puts &employeeObjMgr in ecx
01197       pEmployee4[i] = static_cast<Employee *>(employeeObjectMgr->Allocate());
01198     }
01199     catch (const OAException& e)
01200     {
01201       if (SHOW_EXCEPTIONS)
01202       {
01203           // ******************** Hoses the ecx register containing &employeeObjMgr
01204         cout << e.what() << endl;
01205       }
01206       else
01207         cout << "Exception thrown from Allocate (2) in DoEmployees."  << endl;
01208 
01209       break;
01210     }
01211     catch(...)
01212     {
01213       cout << "Unexpected exception thrown from Allocate (2) in DoEmployees."  << endl;
01214     }
01215   }
01216     // ************************* blindly pushes ecx as if it still has &empObjMgr
01217   PrintCounts(employeeObjectMgr); 
01218 
01219   try
01220   {
01221     employeeObjectMgr->Free(pEmployee1);
01222     PrintCounts(employeeObjectMgr);
01223     employeeObjectMgr->Free(pEmployee2);
01224     PrintCounts(employeeObjectMgr);
01225     employeeObjectMgr->Free(pEmployee3);
01226     PrintCounts(employeeObjectMgr);
01227   }
01228   catch (const OAException& e)
01229   {
01230     if (SHOW_EXCEPTIONS)
01231       cout << e.what() << endl;
01232     else
01233       cout << "Exception thrown from Free in DoEmployees."  << endl;
01234   }
01235   catch(...)
01236   {
01237     cout << "Unexpected exception thrown from Free in DoEmployees."  << endl;
01238   }
01239 
01240     // Free an object twice
01241   try {
01242     employeeObjectMgr->Free(pEmployee1);
01243   }
01244   catch (const OAException& e) 
01245   {
01246     if (SHOW_EXCEPTIONS)
01247       cout << e.what() << endl;
01248     else
01249       cout << "Exception thrown from Free (Freeing object twice) in DoEmployees."  << endl;
01250   }
01251   catch(...)
01252   {
01253     cout << "Unexpected exception thrown from Free (Freeing object twice) in DoEmployees."  << endl;
01254   }
01255 
01256     // Free an invalid pointer (bad boundary condition)
01257   try 
01258   {
01259     employeeObjectMgr->Free(reinterpret_cast<char *>(pEmployee4[0]) + 4);
01260   }
01261   catch (const OAException& e) 
01262   {
01263     if (SHOW_EXCEPTIONS)
01264       cout << e.what() << endl;
01265     else
01266       cout << "Exception thrown from Free (Freeing address on bad boundary) in DoEmployees."  << endl;
01267   }
01268   catch(...)
01269   {
01270     cout << "Unexpected exception thrown from Free (Freeing address on bad boundary) in DoEmployees."  << endl;
01271   }
01272 
01273   cout << "Most employees in use: " << employeeObjectMgr->GetStats().MostObjects_<< endl;
01274   delete employeeObjectMgr;
01275 }

01277 //****************************************************************************************************
01278 //****************************************************************************************************
01279 void DisableOA(void)
01280 {
01281   try 
01282   {
01283     bool newdel = true;
01284     bool debug = false;
01285     unsigned padbytes = 0;
01286     OAConfig::HeaderBlockInfo header(OAConfig::hbNone);
01287     unsigned alignment = 0;
01288 
01289     OAConfig config(newdel, 4, 2, debug, padbytes, header, alignment);
01290     studentObjectMgr = new ObjectAllocator(sizeof(Student), config);
01291   }
01292   catch (const OAException& e)
01293   {
01294     if (SHOW_EXCEPTIONS)
01295       cout << e.what() << endl;
01296     else
01297       cout << "Exception thrown during constructor in DisableOA."  << endl;
01298     return;
01299   }
01300   catch(...)
01301   {
01302     cout << "Unexpected exception thrown during constructor in DisableOA."  << endl;
01303   }
01304 
01305   PrintConfig(studentObjectMgr);
01306   PrintCounts2(studentObjectMgr);
01307 
01308   Student *pStudent1 = 0, *pStudent2 = 0, *pStudent3 = 0;
01309   try
01310   {
01311     pStudent1 = static_cast<Student *>( studentObjectMgr->Allocate() );
01312     PrintCounts2(studentObjectMgr);
01313     pStudent2 = static_cast<Student *>( studentObjectMgr->Allocate() );
01314     PrintCounts2(studentObjectMgr);
01315     pStudent3 = static_cast<Student *>( studentObjectMgr->Allocate() );
01316     PrintCounts2(studentObjectMgr);
01317   }
01318   catch (const OAException& e)
01319   {
01320     if (SHOW_EXCEPTIONS)
01321       cout << e.what() << endl;
01322     else
01323       cout << "Exception thrown from Allocate in DisableOA."  << endl;
01324   }
01325   catch(...)
01326   {
01327     cout << "Unexpected exception thrown from Allocate in DisableOA."  << endl;
01328   }
01329 
01330   Student *pStudent4[6];
01331   for (int i = 0; i < 6; i++)
01332   {
01333     try
01334     {
01335       pStudent4[i] = static_cast<Student *>( studentObjectMgr->Allocate() );
01336     }
01337     catch (const OAException& e)
01338     {
01339       if (SHOW_EXCEPTIONS)
01340         cout << e.what() << endl;
01341       else
01342         cout << "Exception thrown from Allocate (2) in DisableOA."  << endl;
01343       break;
01344     }
01345     catch(...)
01346     {
01347       cout << "Unexpected exception thrown from Allocate (2) in DisableOA."  << endl;
01348     }
01349 
01350   }
01351   PrintCounts2(studentObjectMgr);
01352 
01353   try
01354   {
01355     studentObjectMgr->Free(pStudent1);
01356     PrintCounts2(studentObjectMgr);
01357     studentObjectMgr->Free(pStudent2);
01358     PrintCounts2(studentObjectMgr);
01359     studentObjectMgr->Free(pStudent3);
01360     PrintCounts2(studentObjectMgr);
01361   }
01362   catch (const OAException& e)
01363   {
01364     if (SHOW_EXCEPTIONS)
01365       cout << e.what() << endl;
01366     else
01367       cout << "Exception thrown from Free in DisableOA."  << endl;
01368   }
01369   catch(...)
01370   {
01371     cout << "Unexpected exception thrown from Free in DIsableOA."  << endl;
01372   }
01373 
01374   for (int i = 0; i < 6; i++)
01375   {
01376     try
01377     {
01378       studentObjectMgr->Free(pStudent4[i]);
01379     }
01380     catch (const OAException& e)
01381     {
01382       if (SHOW_EXCEPTIONS)
01383         cout << e.what() << endl;
01384       else
01385         cout << "Exception thrown from Free in DisableOA."  << endl;
01386       break;
01387     }
01388     catch(...)
01389     {
01390       cout << "Unexpected exception thrown from Free in DisableOA."  << endl;
01391     }
01392 
01393   }
01394   PrintCounts2(studentObjectMgr);
01395 
01396   cout << "Most students in use: " << studentObjectMgr->GetStats().MostObjects_ << endl;
01397   delete studentObjectMgr;
01398 }

01400 //****************************************************************************************************
01401 //****************************************************************************************************
01402 void TestCorruption(void)
01403 {
01404   ObjectAllocator *oa = 0;
01405   unsigned char *p;
01406   unsigned padbytes = 8;
01407   unsigned i;
01408   unsigned wrap = 32;
01409   Student *pStudent1, *pStudent2 = 0;
01410   try 
01411   {
01412     bool newdel = false;
01413     bool debug = true;
01414     //unsigned header = 0;
01415     //OAConfig::HBLOCK_TYPE header = OAConfig::hbNone;
01416     OAConfig::HeaderBlockInfo header(OAConfig::hbBasic);
01417     unsigned alignment = 0;
01418 
01419     OAConfig config(newdel, 4, 2, debug, padbytes, header, alignment);
01420     //OAConfig config(false, 4, 2, true, padbytes);
01421     oa = new ObjectAllocator(sizeof(Student), config);
01422     pStudent1 = static_cast<Student *>( oa->Allocate() );
01423     pStudent2 = static_cast<Student *>( oa->Allocate() );
01424     
01425     PrintConfig(oa);
01426     PrintCounts(oa);
01427     DumpPages(oa, wrap);
01428   }
01429   catch (const OAException& e)
01430   {
01431     if (SHOW_EXCEPTIONS)
01432       cout << e.what() << endl;
01433     else
01434       cout << "Exception thrown during construction/allocation in TestCorruption."  << endl;
01435 
01436     return;
01437   }
01438 
01439     // corrupt left pad bytes
01440   p = const_cast<unsigned char*>(reinterpret_cast<const unsigned char *>(pStudent1)) - padbytes;
01441   for (i = 0; i < padbytes - 2; i++)
01442     *p++ = 0xFF;
01443 
01444     // corrupt right pad bytes
01445   p = const_cast<unsigned char*>(reinterpret_cast<const unsigned char *>(pStudent2)) + sizeof(Student);
01446   for (i = 0; i < padbytes - 2; i++)
01447     *p++ = 0xEE;
01448 
01449   try
01450   {
01451     oa->Free(pStudent1);
01452   }
01453   catch (const OAException& e)
01454   {
01455     if (SHOW_EXCEPTIONS)
01456       cout << e.what() << endl;
01457     else
01458     {
01459       if (e.code() == e.E_CORRUPTED_BLOCK)
01460         cout << "Exception thrown from Free: E_CORRUPTED_BLOCK on left"  << endl;
01461       else
01462         cout << "****** Unknown OAException thrown from Free in TestCorruption. ******"  << endl;
01463     }
01464   }
01465   catch(...)
01466   {
01467     cout << "Unexpected exception thrown from Free in TestCorruption."  << endl;
01468   }
01469 
01470   try
01471   {
01472     oa->Free(pStudent2);
01473   }
01474   catch (const OAException& e)
01475   {
01476     if (SHOW_EXCEPTIONS)
01477       cout << e.what() << endl;
01478     else
01479     {
01480       if (e.code() == e.E_CORRUPTED_BLOCK)
01481         cout << "Exception thrown from Free: E_CORRUPTED_BLOCK on right"  << endl;
01482       else
01483         cout << "****** Unknown OAException thrown from Free (2) in TestCorruption. ******"  << endl;
01484     }
01485   }
01486   catch(...)
01487   {
01488     cout << "Unexpected exception thrown from Free (2) in TestCorruption."  << endl;
01489   }
01490 
01491   delete oa;
01492 }
01493 
01494 //****************************************************************************************************
01495 //****************************************************************************************************
01496 void TestLeak(void)
01497 {
01498   unsigned count = 0;
01499   Employee **pEmps = 0;
01500 
01501   try
01502   {
01503     bool newdel = false;
01504     bool debug = true;
01505     unsigned padbytes = 0;
01506     OAConfig::HeaderBlockInfo header(OAConfig::hbBasic);
01507     unsigned alignment = 0;
01508 
01509     OAConfig config(newdel, 4, 8, debug, padbytes, header, alignment);
01510     employeeObjectMgr = new ObjectAllocator(sizeof(Employee), config);
01511   }
01512   catch (const OAException& e)
01513   {
01514     if (SHOW_EXCEPTIONS)
01515       cout << e.what() << endl;
01516     else
01517       cout << "Exception thrown during constructor in TestLeak."  << endl;
01518 
01519     return;
01520   }
01521   catch(...)
01522   {
01523     cout << "Unexpected exception thrown during constructor in TestLeak."  << endl;
01524   }
01525 
01526   PrintConfig(employeeObjectMgr);
01527   PrintCounts(employeeObjectMgr);
01528 
01529   count = employeeObjectMgr->GetConfig().MaxPages_ * employeeObjectMgr->GetConfig().ObjectsPerPage_;
01530   pEmps = new Employee *[count];
01531 
01532   for (unsigned i = 0; i < count; i++)
01533   {
01534     try 
01535     {
01536       pEmps[i] = static_cast<Employee *>(employeeObjectMgr->Allocate());
01537       FillEmployee(*pEmps[i]);
01538     }
01539     catch (const OAException& e)
01540     {
01541       if (SHOW_EXCEPTIONS)
01542         cout << e.what() << endl;
01543       else
01544         cout << "Exception thrown from Allocate in TestLeak."  << endl;
01545 
01546       break;
01547     }
01548     catch(...)
01549     {
01550       cout << "Unexpected exception thrown from Allocate in TestLeak."  << endl;
01551     }
01552   }
01553   PrintCounts(employeeObjectMgr); 
01554 
01555   try
01556   {
01557     for (unsigned i = 0; i < count; i += 2)
01558       employeeObjectMgr->Free(pEmps[i]);
01559   }
01560   catch (const OAException& e)
01561   {
01562     if (SHOW_EXCEPTIONS)
01563       cout << e.what() << endl;
01564     else
01565       cout << "Exception thrown from Free in TestLeak."  << endl;
01566   }
01567   catch(...)
01568   {
01569     cout << "Unexpected exception thrown from Free in TestLeak."  << endl;
01570   }
01571 
01572   PrintCounts(employeeObjectMgr);
01573 
01574   cout << "Most employees in use: " << employeeObjectMgr->GetStats().MostObjects_<< endl;
01575 
01576   cout << "\nChecking for leaks...\n";
01577   CheckAndDumpLeaks(employeeObjectMgr);
01578 
01579   try
01580   {
01581     for (unsigned i = 1; i < count; i += 2)
01582       employeeObjectMgr->Free(pEmps[i]);
01583   }
01584   catch (const OAException& e)
01585   {
01586     if (SHOW_EXCEPTIONS)
01587       cout << e.what() << endl;
01588     else
01589       cout << "Exception thrown from Free (2) in TestLeak."  << endl;
01590   }
01591   catch(...)
01592   {
01593     cout << "Unexpected exception thrown from Free (2) in TestLeak."  << endl;
01594   }
01595 
01596   cout << "\nChecking for leaks...\n";
01597   CheckAndDumpLeaks(employeeObjectMgr);
01598 
01599   delete employeeObjectMgr;
01600   delete [] pEmps;
01601 }

01604 //****************************************************************************************************
01605 //****************************************************************************************************
01606 void TestValidate(void)
01607 {
01608   ObjectAllocator *oa = 0;
01609   unsigned char *p;
01610   unsigned i, padbytes = 8;
01611   unsigned wrap = 32;
01612   Student *pStudent1 = 0, *pStudent2 = 0, *pStudent7 = 0;
01613   try 
01614   {
01615     bool newdel = false;
01616     bool debug = true;
01617     OAConfig::HeaderBlockInfo header(OAConfig::hbBasic);
01618     unsigned alignment = 0;
01619 
01620     OAConfig config(newdel, 4, 2, debug, padbytes, header, alignment);
01621     oa = new ObjectAllocator(sizeof(Student), config);
01622 
01623     pStudent1 = static_cast<Student *>( oa->Allocate() );
01624     pStudent2 = static_cast<Student *>( oa->Allocate() );
01625     oa->Allocate(); // 3
01626     oa->Allocate(); // 4
01627     oa->Allocate(); // 5
01628     oa->Allocate(); // 6
01629     pStudent7 = static_cast<Student *>( oa->Allocate() );
01630     PrintConfig(oa);
01631     PrintCounts(oa);
01632     DumpPages(oa, wrap);
01633   }
01634   catch (const OAException& e)
01635   {
01636     if (SHOW_EXCEPTIONS)
01637       cout << e.what() << endl;
01638     else
01639       cout << "Exception thrown during construction/allocation in TestValidate."  << endl;
01640     return;
01641   }
01642 
01643   try
01644   {
01645       // Validate a good heap
01646     unsigned count = oa->ValidatePages(ValidateCallback);
01647     cout << "Number of corruptions: " << count << endl << endl;
01648   }
01649   catch (const OAException& e)
01650   {
01651     if (SHOW_EXCEPTIONS)
01652       cout << e.what() << endl;
01653     else
01654     {
01655       if (e.code() == e.E_CORRUPTED_BLOCK)
01656         cout << "Exception thrown from Free: E_CORRUPTED_BLOCK on left"  << endl;
01657       else
01658         cout << "****** Unknown OAException thrown from Free in TestValidate. ******"  << endl;
01659     }
01660   }
01661   catch(...)
01662   {
01663     cout << "Unexpected exception thrown from Free in TestValidate."  << endl;
01664   }
01665 
01666     // corrupt left pad bytes of 1
01667   p = const_cast<unsigned char*>(reinterpret_cast<const unsigned char *>(pStudent1)) - padbytes;
01668   for (i = 0; i < padbytes - 2; i++)
01669     *p++ = 0xFF;
01670 
01671     // corrupt right pad bytes of 2
01672   p = const_cast<unsigned char*>(reinterpret_cast<const unsigned char *>(pStudent2)) + sizeof(Student);
01673   for (i = 0; i < padbytes - 2; i++)
01674     *p++ = 0xEE;
01675 
01676   PrintCounts(oa);
01677   DumpPages(oa, wrap);
01678 
01679   try
01680   {
01681       // Validate a corrupted heap
01682     unsigned count = oa->ValidatePages(ValidateCallback);
01683     cout << "Number of corruptions: " << count << endl << endl;
01684   }
01685   catch (const OAException& e)
01686   {
01687     if (SHOW_EXCEPTIONS)
01688       cout << e.what() << endl;
01689     else
01690     {
01691       if (e.code() == e.E_CORRUPTED_BLOCK)
01692         cout << "Exception thrown from Free: E_CORRUPTED_BLOCK on left"  << endl;
01693       else
01694         cout << "****** Unknown OAException thrown from Free (2) in TestValidate. ******"  << endl;
01695     }
01696   }
01697   catch(...)
01698   {
01699     cout << "Unexpected exception thrown from Free (2) in TestValidate."  << endl;
01700   }
01701 
01702     // corrupt left pad bytes of 7
01703   p = const_cast<unsigned char*>(reinterpret_cast<const unsigned char *>(pStudent7)) - padbytes;
01704   for (i = 0; i < padbytes - 2; i++)
01705     *p++ = 0xFF;
01706 
01707     // corrupt right pad bytes of 7
01708   p = const_cast<unsigned char*>(reinterpret_cast<const unsigned char *>(pStudent7)) + sizeof(Student);
01709   for (i = 0; i < padbytes - 2; i++)
01710     *p++ = 0xEE;
01711 
01712   PrintCounts(oa);
01713   DumpPages(oa, wrap);
01714 
01715   try
01716   {
01717       // Validate a corrupted heap
01718     unsigned count = oa->ValidatePages(ValidateCallback);
01719     cout << "Number of corruptions: " << count << endl << endl;
01720   }
01721   catch (const OAException& e)
01722   {
01723     if (SHOW_EXCEPTIONS)
01724       cout << e.what() << endl;
01725     else
01726     {
01727       if (e.code() == e.E_CORRUPTED_BLOCK)
01728         cout << "Exception thrown from Free: E_CORRUPTED_BLOCK on left"  << endl;
01729       else
01730         cout << "****** Unknown OAException thrown from Free (3) in TestValidate. ******"  << endl;
01731     }
01732   }
01733   catch(...)
01734   {
01735     cout << "Unexpected exception thrown from Free (3) in TestValidate."  << endl;
01736   }
01737   if (oa)
01738     delete oa;
01739 }

01741 //****************************************************************************************************
01742 //****************************************************************************************************
01743 void TestAlignment(void)
01744 {
01745   if (!ObjectAllocator::ImplementedExtraCredit())
01746     return;
01747 
01748   ObjectAllocator *oa = 0;
01749   try 
01750   {
01751     unsigned wrap = 32;
01752 
01753     bool newdel = false;
01754     bool debug = true;
01755     unsigned padbytes = 2;
01756     //unsigned header = 0;
01757     OAConfig::HeaderBlockInfo header(OAConfig::hbBasic);
01758     unsigned alignment = 8;
01759 
01760     OAConfig config(newdel, 3, 2, debug, padbytes, header, alignment);
01761 
01762     if (!oa)
01763       oa = new ObjectAllocator(sizeof(Student), config);
01764 
01765     PrintConfig(oa);
01766     PrintCounts(oa);
01767     DumpPages(oa, wrap);
01768 
01769     oa->Allocate(); // 1
01770     oa->Allocate(); // 2
01771     oa->Allocate(); // 3
01772     oa->Allocate(); // 4
01773     oa->Allocate(); // 5
01774     oa->Allocate(); // 6
01775 
01776     PrintCounts(oa);
01777     DumpPages(oa, wrap);
01778   }
01779   catch (const OAException& e)
01780   {
01781     if (SHOW_EXCEPTIONS)
01782       cout << e.what() << endl;
01783     else
01784       cout << "Exception thrown during construction/allocation in TestAlignment."  << endl;
01785     return;
01786   }
01787   if (oa)
01788     delete oa;
01789 }

01791 
01792 void PrintCounts(const ObjectAllocator *nm)
01793 {
01794   OAStats stats = nm->GetStats();
01795   cout << "Pages in use: " << stats.PagesInUse_;
01796   cout << ", Objects in use: " << stats.ObjectsInUse_;
01797   cout << ", Available objects: " << stats.FreeObjects_;
01798   cout << ", Allocs: " << stats.Allocations_;
01799   cout << ", Frees: " << stats.Deallocations_ << endl;
01800 }
01801 
01802 void PrintCounts2(const ObjectAllocator *nm)
01803 {
01804   OAStats stats = nm->GetStats();
01805   cout << "Allocs: " << stats.Allocations_;
01806   cout << ", Frees: " << stats.Deallocations_ << endl;
01807 }
01808 
01809 void PrintConfig(const ObjectAllocator *oa)
01810 {
01811   cout << "Object size = " << oa->GetStats().ObjectSize_;
01812   cout << ", Page size = " << oa->GetStats().PageSize_;
01813   cout << ", Pad bytes = " << oa->GetConfig().PadBytes_;
01814   cout << ", ObjectsPerPage = " << oa->GetConfig().ObjectsPerPage_;
01815   cout << ", MaxPages = " << oa->GetConfig().MaxPages_;
01816   cout << ", MaxObjects = " <<  oa->GetConfig().ObjectsPerPage_ * oa->GetConfig().MaxPages_;
01817   cout << endl;
01818   cout << "Alignment = " << oa->GetConfig().Alignment_;
01819   cout << ", LeftAlign = " << oa->GetConfig().LeftAlignSize_;
01820   cout << ", InterAlign = " << oa->GetConfig().InterAlignSize_;
01821   cout << ", HeaderBlocks = ";
01822   if (oa->GetConfig().HBlockInfo_.type_ == OAConfig::hbNone)
01823     cout << "None";
01824   else if (oa->GetConfig().HBlockInfo_.type_ == OAConfig::hbBasic)
01825     cout << "Basic";
01826   else if (oa->GetConfig().HBlockInfo_.type_ == OAConfig::hbExtended)
01827     cout << "Extended";
01828   else if (oa->GetConfig().HBlockInfo_.type_ == OAConfig::hbExternal)
01829     cout << "External";
01830   cout << ", Header size = " << oa->GetConfig().HBlockInfo_.size_;
01831   cout << endl;
01832 }
01833 
01834 void DumpPages(const ObjectAllocator *nm, unsigned width)
01835 {
01836   const unsigned char *pages = static_cast<const unsigned char *>(nm->GetPageList());
01837   const unsigned char *realpage = pages;
01838   
01839   size_t header_size = nm->GetConfig().HBlockInfo_.size_;
01840 
01841   while (pages)
01842   {
01843     unsigned count = 0;
01844 
01845     if (SHOWREAL)
01846       printf("%p\n", pages);
01847     else
01848       printf("XXXXXXXX\n");
01849 
01850           // print column header
01851     for (unsigned j = 0; j < width; j++)
01852       printf(" %2i", j);
01853     printf("\n");
01854 
01855       // "Next page" pointer in the page
01856     if (SHOWREAL)
01857     {
01858       for (unsigned i = 0; i < sizeof(void *); i++, count++)
01859         printf(" %02X", *pages++);
01860     }
01861     else
01862     {
01863       for (unsigned j = 0; j < sizeof(void *); pages++, count++, j++)
01864         printf(" %s", "XX");
01865     }
01866 
01867 
01868       // Left leading alignment bytes
01869     if (nm->GetConfig().Alignment_ > 1)
01870     {
01871         // leading alignment block (if any)
01872       for (unsigned j = 0; j < nm->GetConfig().LeftAlignSize_; count++, j++)
01873       {
01874         if (count >= width)
01875         {
01876           printf("\n");
01877           count = 0;
01878         }
01879         printf(" %02X", *pages++);
01880       }
01881     }
01882 
01883       // Dump each object and its associated info
01884     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < nm->GetConfig().ObjectsPerPage_ ; i++)
01885     {
01886         // inter-block alignment (not on first block)
01887       if (i > 0)
01888       {
01889         for (unsigned j = 0; j < nm->GetConfig().InterAlignSize_; count++, j++)
01890         {
01891           if (count >= width)
01892           {
01893             printf("\n");
01894             count = 0;
01895           }
01896           printf(" %02X", *pages++);
01897         }
01898       }
01899 
01900         // header block bytes
01901       for (unsigned j = 0; j < header_size; count++, j++)
01902       {
01903         if (count >= width)
01904         {
01905           printf("\n");
01906           count = 0;
01907         }
01908         printf(" %02X", *pages++);
01909       }
01910 
01911         // left padding
01912       for (unsigned j = 0; j < nm->GetConfig().PadBytes_; count++, j++)
01913       {
01914         if (count >= width)
01915         {
01916           printf("\n");
01917           count = 0;
01918         }
01919         printf(" %02X", *pages++);
01920       }
01921 
01922         // possible next pointer (zero it out)
01923       for (unsigned j = 0; j < sizeof(void *); count++, pages++, j++)
01924       {
01925         if (count >= width)
01926         {
01927           printf("\n");
01928           count = 0;
01929         }
01930         if (SHOWREAL)
01931           printf(" %02X", *pages);
01932         else
01933           printf(" %s", "XX");
01934       }
01935         
01936         // remaining bytes
01937       for (unsigned j = 0; j < nm->GetStats().ObjectSize_ - sizeof(void *); count++, j++)
01938       {
01939         if (count >= width)
01940         {
01941           printf("\n");
01942           count = 0;
01943         }
01944         printf(" %02X", *pages++);
01945       }
01946 
01947         // right pad bytes
01948       for (unsigned j = 0; j < nm->GetConfig().PadBytes_; count++, j++)
01949       {
01950         if (count >= width)
01951         {
01952           printf("\n");
01953           count = 0;
01954         }
01955         printf(" %02X", *pages++);
01956       }
01957 
01958     }
01959     printf("\n\n");
01960 
01961     pages = reinterpret_cast<const unsigned char *>((reinterpret_cast<const GenericObject *>(realpage))->Next);
01962     realpage = pages;
01963   }
01964 }
01965 
01966 void DumpExternalHeaders(const ObjectAllocator *oa, const unsigned char *p)
01967 {
01968   unsigned char *page = const_cast<unsigned char *>(p);
01969 
01970   unsigned padbytes = oa->GetConfig().PadBytes_;  
01971   size_t header_size = oa->GetConfig().HBlockInfo_.size_;
01972   unsigned leftalign = oa->GetConfig().LeftAlignSize_;
01973   unsigned interalign = oa->GetConfig().InterAlignSize_;
01974   unsigned count = oa->GetConfig().ObjectsPerPage_;
01975   size_t offset = padbytes * 2 + header_size + interalign + oa->GetStats().ObjectSize_;
01976 
01977   page += sizeof(void *); // the 'next' pointer
01978   page += leftalign;      // the left alignment bytes (if any)
01979 
01980     // We're now pointing at the beginning of the header block
01981 
01982   MemBlockInfo *pm = reinterpret_cast<MemBlockInfo *>(*reinterpret_cast<MemBlockInfo **>(page));
01983   cout << "  Label: " << (pm && pm->label ? pm->label : "") << std::endl;
01984   cout << " In use: " << (pm ? pm->in_use : 0) << std::endl;
01985   cout << "Alloc #: " << (pm && pm->in_use ? pm->alloc_num : 0) << std::endl;
01986 
01987   for (unsigned i = 1; i < count; i++)
01988   {
01989     page += offset;
01990     MemBlockInfo *pm = reinterpret_cast<MemBlockInfo *>(*reinterpret_cast<MemBlockInfo **>(page));
01991     cout << "  Label: " << (pm && pm->label ? pm->label : "") << std::endl;
01992     cout << " In use: " << (pm ? pm->in_use : 0) << std::endl;
01993     cout << "Alloc #: " << (pm && pm->in_use ? pm->alloc_num : 0) << std::endl;
01994   }
01995 }
01996 
01997 void DumpPagesEx(const ObjectAllocator *nm, unsigned width)
01998 {
01999   const unsigned char *pages = static_cast<const unsigned char *>(nm->GetPageList());
02000   const unsigned char *realpage = pages;
02001   
02002   size_t header_size = nm->GetConfig().HBlockInfo_.size_;
02003 
02004   while (pages)
02005   {
02006     unsigned count = 0;
02007 
02008     if (SHOWREAL)
02009       printf("%p\n", pages);
02010     else
02011       printf("XXXXXXXX\n");
02012 
02013           // print column header
02014     for (unsigned j = 0; j < width; j++)
02015       printf(" %2i", j);
02016     printf("\n");
02017 
02018     if (SHOWREAL)
02019     {
02020       for (unsigned i = 0; i < sizeof(void *); i++, count++)
02021         printf(" %02X", *pages++);
02022     }
02023     else
02024     {
02025       for (unsigned j = 0; j < sizeof(void *); pages++, count++, j++)
02026         printf(" %s", "XX");
02027     }
02028 
02029 
02030       // Left leading alignment bytes
02031     if (nm->GetConfig().Alignment_ > 1)
02032     {
02033         // leading alignment block (if any)
02034       for (unsigned j = 0; j < nm->GetConfig().LeftAlignSize_; count++, j++)
02035       {
02036         if (count >= width)
02037         {
02038           printf("\n");
02039           count = 0;
02040         }
02041         printf(" %02X", *pages++);
02042       }
02043     }
02044 
02045     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < nm->GetConfig().ObjectsPerPage_ ; i++)
02046     {
02047         // inter-block alignment (not on first block)
02048       if (i > 0)
02049       {
02050         for (unsigned j = 0; j < nm->GetConfig().InterAlignSize_; count++, j++)
02051         {
02052           if (count >= width)
02053           {
02054             printf("\n");
02055             count = 0;
02056           }
02057           printf(" %02X", *pages++);
02058         }
02059       }
02060 
02061         // header block bytes
02062       for (unsigned j = 0; j < header_size; count++, j++, pages++)
02063       {
02064         if (count >= width)
02065         {
02066           printf("\n");
02067           count = 0;
02068         }
02069         /*////////////////////======================================================================
02070         In external mode, pointer address is embedded into the header memory
02072         if (SHOWREAL)
02073           printf(" %02X", *pages);
02074         else
02075           printf(" %s", "XX");
02076       }
02077 
02078         // left padding
02079       for (unsigned j = 0; j < nm->GetConfig().PadBytes_; count++, j++)
02080       {
02081         if (count >= width)
02082         {
02083           printf("\n");
02084           count = 0;
02085         }
02086         printf(" %02X", *pages++);
02087       }
02088 
02089         // possible next pointer (zero it out)
02090       for (unsigned j = 0; j < sizeof(void *); count++, pages++, j++)
02091       {
02092         if (count >= width)
02093         {
02094           printf("\n");
02095           count = 0;
02096         }
02097         if (SHOWREAL)
02098           printf(" %02X", *pages);
02099         else
02100           printf(" %s", "XX");
02101       }
02102         
02103         // remaining bytes
02104       for (unsigned j = 0; j < nm->GetStats().ObjectSize_ - sizeof(void *); count++, j++)
02105       {
02106         if (count >= width)
02107         {
02108           printf("\n");
02109           count = 0;
02110         }
02111         printf(" %02X", *pages++);
02112       }
02113 
02114         // right pad bytes
02115       for (unsigned j = 0; j < nm->GetConfig().PadBytes_; count++, j++)
02116       {
02117         if (count >= width)
02118         {
02119           printf("\n");
02120 
02121 
02122 
02123           count = 0;
02124         }
02125         printf(" %02X", *pages++);
02126       }
02127 
02128     }
02129     printf("\n");
02130     DumpExternalHeaders(nm, realpage);
02131     printf("\n");
02132 
02133     pages = reinterpret_cast<const unsigned char *>((reinterpret_cast<const GenericObject *>(realpage))->Next);
02134     realpage = pages;
02135   }
02136 }

02138 void Test1(void)
02139 {
02140   ObjectAllocator *oa;
02141     
02142     bool newdel = false;
02143     bool debug = false;
02144     unsigned padbytes = 0;
02145     OAConfig::HeaderBlockInfo header(OAConfig::hbExternal);
02146     unsigned alignment = 0;
02147 
02148     OAConfig config(newdel, 1, 1, debug, padbytes, header, alignment);
02149     oa  = new ObjectAllocator(sizeof(Student), config);
02150 
02151     oa->Allocate();
02152 
02153     PrintConfig(oa);
02154     PrintCounts(oa);
02155     DumpPagesEx(oa, 32);
02156 
02157     delete oa;
02158 }

02160 
02161 int main(int argc, char **argv)
02162 {
02163 #ifdef _MSC_VER
02164     _CrtSetDbgFlag ( _CRTDBG_ALLOC_MEM_DF | _CRTDBG_LEAK_CHECK_DF );
02165     _CrtSetReportMode(_CRT_WARN, _CRTDBG_MODE_FILE);
02166     _CrtSetReportFile(_CRT_WARN, _CRTDBG_FILE_STDERR);
02167 #endif
02168 
02169   int test = 0;
02170 
02171   if (argc > 1)
02172     test = std::atoi(argv[1]);
02173   if (argc > 2)
02174     SHOWADDRESS1 = std::atoi(argv[2]);
02175   if (argc > 3)
02176     SHOWADDRESS2 = std::atoi(argv[3]);
02177   if (argc > 4)
02178     SHOWREAL = std::atoi(argv[4]);
02179   if (argc > 5)
02180     SHOW_EXCEPTIONS = std::atoi(argv[5]);
02181   if (argc > 6)
02182     EXTRA_CREDIT = std::atoi(argv[6]);
02183 
02184   switch (test)
02185   {
02186     case 1:
02187       cout << "============================== Students..." << endl;
02188       DoStudents(0, false);
02189       cout << endl;
02190       break;
02191     case 2:
02192       cout << "============================== Students..." << endl;
02193       DoStudents(0, true);
02194       cout << endl;
02195       break;
02196     case 3:
02197       cout << "============================== Employees..." << endl;
02198       DoEmployees();
02199       cout << endl;
02200       break;
02201     case 4:
02202       cout << "============================== Test padding..." << endl;
02203       TestPadding(6);
02204       cout << endl;
02205       break;
02206     case 5:
02207       cout << "============================== Test padding..." << endl;
02208       TestPadding(10);
02209       cout << endl;
02210       break;
02211     case 6:
02212       cout << "============================== Test basic header blocks..." << endl;
02213       TestBasicHeaderBlocks();
02214       cout << endl;
02215       break;
02216     case 7:
02217       cout << "============================== Test extended header blocks(1)..." << endl;
02218       TestExtendedHeaderBlocks(1);
02219       cout << endl;
02220       break;
02221     case 8:
02222       cout << "============================== Test external header blocks..." << endl;
02223       TestExternalHeaderBlocks();
02224       cout << endl;
02225       break;
02226     case 9:
02227       cout << "============================== Test corruption..." << endl;
02228       TestCorruption();
02229       cout << endl;
02230       break;
02231     case 10:
02232       cout << "============================== Test using new/delete..." << endl;
02233       DisableOA();
02234       cout << endl;
02235       break;
02236     case 11:
02237       cout << "============================== Test leak..." << endl;
02238       TestLeak(); 
02239       cout << endl;
02240       break;
02241     case 12:
02242       cout << "============================== Test validate..." << endl;
02243       TestValidate();
02244       cout << endl;
02245       break;
